Package fs.validate

Interface Summary
ComponentValidator<T> A ComponentValidator is an object that can verify the (usually user-generated) content of an object (supposedly a graphical component) and associate a boolean value to it, where true normally indicates a correct value.
Each ComponentValidator can be used for several components, registered via addComponent and to which he should add himself as a listener in some way.
 

Class Summary
AbstractComponentValidator<T> This class provides a standard implementation to the class ComponentValidator.
LabelIndicValidator<T> This class implements a ComponentValidator, where each registered component may be linked to a SwitchIconLabel, which is modified according to the validation status of the component.
SingleButtonValidator This validation validator is linked to a single JButton, which is disabled when an INCORRECT validation occurs and enabled otherwise
ValidationResult Represents the result of a validation run of a ComponentValidator.
ValidationValidator This class serves as a summarizing container for several ComponentValidators.
 

Enum Summary
ValidationResult.Result
